channel.title: Extracting Inventory Icons
channel.description: Where are the icons stored in the cache and how do I extract them?

item.title: Extracting Inventory Icons
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

jSherz:

Thanks for the help! I’m going to use the bank window, a UI button to change the items and taking screenshots then batch editing them with a program. A lot of work but hopefully it’ll get my an icon for every item!

There are dumps for those icons.

item.title: Extracting Inventory Icons
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

jSherz:

Where are the icons stored in the cache and how do I extract them?

You can’t. Not in the sense you’re thinking of. The inventory icons are generated as an image, based on the item model, and the camera orientation (position and rotation) set in the item data table in the cache.

You can either copy the model rendering part and item+model data, and use it in your app (not suggested) or just create an image automatically when you run the client, and dump the image data to a file.

Note that I don’t know the code on how to do either of those.

Read full topic
